channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: “The damage has been done.” Some Shanghai residents say China's strict lockdown has created economic and psychological scars that will endure. https://t.co/a16B9NrJDq
Russian officials said that another of its generals was killed in combat in Ukraine https://t.co/OV5rVI5I61

On Friday, Ukrainian Jews across the country, as well as those now living as refugees in Europe, celebrated Passover with supplies of kosher food and online services provided by American charities https://t.co/k4QcAGTOBI
Politicians threaten to strip Disney of its Mickey Mouse copyright and the special tax status for Walt Disney World, as parents protest in Orlando, Fla. https://t.co/YyRYcPZ80y
Twitter founder Jack Dorsey’s first tweet was converted to a nonfungible token last year and sold for $2.9 million. Now, it may be resold for less than $14,000. https://t.co/PDytyQOqLi
Heard on the Street: Container shipping rates have started sinking. This might only be the beginning of their descent. https://t.co/akMuoQoW6p
McDonald’s suspended its operations in Russia over the war in Ukraine, but some restaurants owned by franchisees still remain open #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/TBxFACiylB https://t.co/k0gtZPhNgv
From @WSJopinion: On Palm Sunday, Robert E. Lee surrendered to Ulysses S. Grant. Lincoln was dead by Easter, writes @Peggynoonannyc https://t.co/dQhfzpsu4B
Politicians threaten to strip Disney of its Mickey Mouse copyright and the special tax status for Walt Disney World, as parents protest in Orlando, Fla. https://t.co/tS9XopJZva
TikTok brain is real, researchers say, and it’s affecting kids’ brain development. "We’ve made kids live in a candy store." https://t.co/AKe3ynUjXV
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/cvqJe4JAZs
The Biden administration is resuming oil leases on federal land, in a policy turnaround https://t.co/kK7D5LfWWF
A Ukrainian city that is shelled by Russia nearly every night stands in the way of Moscow’s plans to control Ukraine’s Black Sea rim https://t.co/ePvpEdU6TS
Is globalization ending in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine? No. It’s evolving. https://t.co/QHt08nibS6
JPMorgan’s new Manhattan headquarters will use a hydroelectric power source, making it the tallest and largest New York building to go all electric https://t.co/0KEfZ9Qjio
About 30,000 people are returning to Ukraine each day, according to a U.N. agency, many of them women, children and older people. https://t.co/iFQNR8AR8n

Six U.S. lawmakers met with Taiwan’s leader on Friday in a show of support for the island democracy, in a surprise trip that signals more tension between Washington and Beijing https://t.co/5bnOHdogt5
The Russian missile cruiser Moskva, which was over 600 feet long and more than 12,000 tons, was the biggest warship by tonnage to sink during conflict since World War II https://t.co/avYDWNKXwT
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/AnAvYi07sw https://t.co/9KQA94YNZK

Which is better: A four-day workweek or five? A proposal in the California Legislature would define the workweek as 32 hours for private-sector companies with more than 500 employees https://t.co/29rG6pJFgA
Employers are trying everything to lure work-from-home employees back to the office. It’s not working. Columnist @JasonGay offers a suggestion: doughnuts. https://t.co/HlteRMOVgj

From @WSJopinion: The war in Ukraine is set to enter a bloody new phase as Vladimir Putin prepares an offensive in the east. The question is whether President Biden will summon the mettle to make sure America’s friends win. https://t.co/r4Ni3nRwv0
The average rate on 30-year mortgages hit 5% for the first time since 2011 https://t.co/mtSGwBcwrg
The world’s richest man should be able to buy anything he wants. But can Elon Musk buy Twitter? https://t.co/EbhrD9nXR2

From the dot-com boom to drilling tunnels, Elon Musk’s long list of business ventures have all built to his $43 billion offer to buy Twitter. Take a look back at his past investments. https://t.co/AWzrYRWGw4

President Biden will nominate Michael Barr as the Federal Reserve’s top banking regulator. His first pick withdrew amid opposition from Republicans and a key Democratic senator. https://t.co/QpIikD2lXi
The U.S. confirmed that the Moskva, the flagship of Russia’s Black Sea fleet, was struck and sunk by a pair of Ukrainian missiles https://t.co/w12IrqDBxe
Elon Musk has spent a lifetime pursuing his convictions—often against great odds—from making space travel affordable to converting the world to electric-powered cars https://t.co/OxeNKkwws6

From @WSJopinion: Elon Musk could make a great social contribution if his Twitter takeover succeeds and he can find the right balance between free speech and sensible moderation https://t.co/oejjnqhy2p
Breaking: Twitter’s board adopted a poison pill that makes it hard for Elon Musk to buy a significantly larger stake in the company https://t.co/rw44AKLrXO
What do the democracies of India, Brazil, Mexico and South Africa have in common? Their leaders refuse to criticize Vladimir Putin for invading Ukraine https://t.co/8LfRA37X6h
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/wHjmrn1T0t https://t.co/d3M1o9cXiv

From the dot-com boom to drilling tunnels, Elon Musk’s long list of business ventures have all built to his $43 billion offer to buy Twitter. Take a look back at his past investments. https://t.co/0d0UAehPrL
The sinking of the Russian missile cruiser Moskva in the Ukraine war recalls naval battles of World War II https://t.co/wPVHO3nqWr

Russian President Vladimir Putin acknowledged that Western sanctions have stymied its energy industry, the country’s economic engine, and that it will need to reorient oil and gas sales from markets in Europe to Asia https://t.co/l6xiiws7wL
Twitter executives spent years trying to promote "healthier discourse" on the platform, but now Elon Musk wants to take the company in a different direction https://t.co/3yEvrDyQ0m
As Ukraine prepares to resist a new Russian military assault, it likely will be doing so with weapons and equipment the U.S. once considered too risky to provide to Kyiv https://t.co/FVQrXKyvlh

Russia warned on Thursday that it could station nuclear forces in and around a Russian exclave in Northern Europe and bolster its military presence there if Finland and Sweden join the NATO alliance https://t.co/aFDH6lt2ZH

“I invested in Twitter as I believe in its potential to be the platform for free speech around the globe, and I believe free speech is a societal imperative for a functioning democracy,” Elon Musk wrote to Twitter's chairman, according to a Thursday filing https://t.co/sO54WFcv3c

An explosion aboard the Russian missile cruiser the Moskva this week came shortly after the issue of a new Ukrainian postage stamp that highlights the warship in an image celebrating national resistance to Moscow’s invasion https://t.co/WmJ0GhOBBv

Elon Musk has been bumped off the perch as Twitter’s largest shareholder: Asset manager Vanguard Group recently upped its stake in the social-media platform and now owns 82.4 million shares of Twitter, or 10.3% of the company https://t.co/ZA5HvFY2SR

Elon Musk has gone full-on corporate raider a week into his rolling clash with Twitter, offering a $43 billion bid for the company and warning he might sell his stake in Twitter if rebuffed https://t.co/xamP8zwIt8
Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal and his company Kingdom Holding, which have held big stakes in Twitter, dismissed Elon Musk’s offer to buy the social-media platform https://t.co/wRrLWAWhFB

An explosion aboard the Russian missile cruiser the Moskva this week came shortly after the issue of a new Ukrainian postage stamp that highlights the warship in an image celebrating national resistance to Moscow’s invasion https://t.co/Fhx2e39OSU v
As Ukraine prepares to resist a new Russian military assault, it likely will be doing so with weapons and equipment the U.S. once considered too risky to provide to Kyiv https://t.co/4U17gN7Dnb
Breaking: Twitter is weighing a poison pill that would prevent Elon Musk from increasing his stake significantly, a person familiar said https://t.co/6i1zDLSAsK

Elon Musk cited free speech concerns and the future of civilization as the reasons he wants to buy Twitter, saying the social-media platform should be more transparent about how and why it promotes content https://t.co/h0bF78Cftq

Elon Musk has been bumped off the perch as Twitter’s largest shareholder: Asset manager Vanguard Group recently upped its stake in the social-media platform and now owns 82.4 million shares of Twitter, or 10.3% of the company https://t.co/YjLTSyTQvD

From @WSJopinion: Permanently stationing American combat power in the Baltics, while adding U.S. or NATO troops in two or three other parts of Eastern Europe, is an affordable response to NATO’s new Russian threat, writes @MichaelEOHanlon https://t.co/LunPtuAfSY

From @WSJopinion: Putin’s recent appointment of Gen. Aleksandr Dvornikov to command all forces in Ukraine is worrisome. Expect his brutality to exceed even his reprehensible record in Syria, writes Mark Kimmitt. https://t.co/M1QKfSKc0w
